case_vignette: A 9-month-old infant is brought the pediatrician for immunizations and assessment. His parents report that he is eating well and produces several wet diapers every day. He is a happy and curious child. The boy was born at 39 weeks gestation via spontaneous vaginal delivery. He is up to date on all vaccines and is meeting all developmental milestones. The infant’s vital signs are normal. Physical growth is appropriate for his age. The physician notes a loud holosystolic murmur at the left sternal border (grade IV) and orders an echocardiogram which confirms the diagnosis of congenital heart defect. Based on echocardiogram findings, the pediatrician reassures the parents that the infant will be monitored, but most likely will not require surgical intervention.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Cardiovascular System. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I feel fine and don't have any symptoms.
Have you been diagnosed with any cardiovascular conditions in the past?
My doctor noted a loud heart murmur and after some testing, I was diagnosed with a congenital heart defect.
What specific type of congenital heart defect were you diagnosed with?
The specific type of congenital heart defect wasn't mentioned to me.
Did your doctor recommend any follow-up tests or treatments after your diagnosis?
The doctor said I will be monitored but most likely won't need surgery.
Do you have a family history of congenital heart defects or other cardiovascular diseases?
My family history of heart conditions wasn't mentioned.
Are you currently taking any medications related to your heart condition or for any other reason?
No, I'm not taking any medications.
How old are you, and what is your sex?
I'm a 9-month-old male infant.
Final Diagnosis: Congenital heart defect (specific type undetermined).
